original_text:
Patient is a 45-year-old male who presents with fever, dry cough, and fatigue for the past 3 days. Patient also reports loss of taste and smell since yesterday.

Vitals: Temp 38.5°C, HR 95, BP 128/82, RR 18, O2 Sat 94% on room air. Physical exam reveals mild respiratory distress. Lungs with scattered rhonchi bilaterally. No rales or wheezes.

Assessment: Clinical presentation consistent with COVID-19 infection. Plan: COVID-19 PCR test ordered. Patient advised to self-isolate pending results. Symptomatic treatment with acetaminophen for fever. Follow up in 2-3 days.
